intro: Dalechampia osana, commonly known as the Mexican hog peanut, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Dalechampia osana is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local wildlife.
